intro: Sanicula canadensis var. genuina, commonly known as Canadian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous and has been historically used in traditional herbal medicine.
